intro: Soehrensia bruchii var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered soehrensia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
